snippet: The police, after a mistaken arrest, are still looking for the driver of an A.T.V. who sped away on Sunday while dragging an officer 200 feet down a busy Brooklyn street.
abstract: Manhunt is on for driver of four-wheel all-terrain vehicle who ran down a New York City police officer and dragged him nearly 200 feet down a busy Brooklyn street; police initially arrest wrong person and then release sketch of suspect; riding ATVs and dirt bikes is illegal in New York City, and young riders have become a menace in some neighborhoods.
lead_paragraph: The police, after a mistaken arrest, are still looking for the driver of an A.T.V. who sped away on Sunday while dragging an officer 200 feet down a busy Brooklyn street.

headline.main: In A.T.V. Case, a Police Sketch but No Suspect
headline.print_headline: In A.T.V. Case, a Police Sketch but No Suspect
